intro: Hieracium succisum, commonly known as the creeping hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can form dense mats due to its stolons. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Hieracium succisum is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along riverbanks.
